Literature Review: Galactic dynamos are a crucial aspect of understanding the large-scale magnetic fields present in spiral galaxies, including the Milky Way. The dominant theory attributes these magnetic fields to a large-scale dynamo, which is a complex process involving the interaction of magnetic fields, gas, and dust within the galaxy. In this review, we will discuss the current status of dynamo theory, the results of numerical simulations, and the role of the circumgalactic medium (CGM) in driving dynamo action. We will also summarize our main conclusions and highlight areas for future research.
